medical_history.chief_complaint: Shortened long bones and significant cardiac findings in fetus.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Initial suspicion of short long bones was raised during the first trimester ultrasound. By 16 weeks, long bones remained shortened with fixed flexion at the elbow, wrist, and knee joints, along with bilateral talipes. Serial scans indicated severe shortening of the long bones, lagging 10 weeks behind dates at 33 weeks' gestation. By mid-gestation, bilateral fractures of the femur and humerus were diagnosed, and kyphosis of the lower lumbar spine was noted. At 35 weeks, new-onset fetal cardiac findings were revealed, leading to a transfer to a tertiary center. The fetus was in breech presentation with significant cardiomegaly.
